result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Adan Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run - Resulting In Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 12 MONTHS of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
The court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges; DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections; balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision; any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Restitution is set to Zero.
Seek and maintain full time employment or verify school enrollment.

No law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No driving without a valid license.
Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

charges.descr: Hit and Run - Resulting In Death
Knowingly Operate Motor Vehicle While Revoked - Cause Death Of Another

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Adan Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Character letters in support of defendant, filed.

Defendant Mario Adan Hernandez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing. State is in compliance with victim notification. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Sentencing proceeded.  Sentencing statements by defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS, with credit for 10 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 12 MONTHS of Initial Confinement. 

Terms of probation and extended supervision:
No law violations rising to the level of probable cause
Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
Seek and maintain full time employment or verify school enrollment
No driving without a valid license
Drivers License revocation for 5 YEARS
Provide DNA sample
Restitution is set at Zero.

The court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges; DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections; balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision; any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Appellate rights given.

Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
character letters

Defendant Mario Adan Hernandez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mario Adan Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense awaiting offer.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Adan Hernandez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared on behalf of Michael Schindhelm for the State of Wisconsin.  Mario Adan Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense has discovery, no offer.  Case remains calendared in Branch 34.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am by zoom.

JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Mario Adan Hernandez in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Adan Hernandez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Mario Adan Hernandez in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mario Adan Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
